title: Fantastic practice
body: Very covid safe, very friendly, the Dr I saw today was fantastic as always, diagnosed my problem within seconds of seeing my foot, gave me a injection in my foot, now 12 hours later, problem going away nicely, thank you for seeing me so fast üòÅüëç

title: Amazing Team
body: After almost 8 weeks on ICU, the team have looked after my husband (and me) through the most traumatic time. They are amazing how they work together, give the best care, have understanding and patience. At such a difficult time we have met the most wonderful and humble people. Thank you üåà

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: OUTSTANDING receptionist
body: I suffer will mental health and called the surgery,every time I call the receptionists they are  always helpful and display patience and empathy and they really understand my needs.Thank you especially to receptionist K

title: Terrible practise
body: Unable to access appointment very rude and un helpful reception staff.no people skills no empathy.i ended up going to A&E for my symptoms on this occasion. Numerous times not been able to access any help from this surgery.

title: Care of patient
body:
My husband was admitted to the A&E department last Friday after difficulty breathing, although the wait time was hours the staff and receptionists were extremely helpful and kind. He was sent to the ‚ÄúMajors ‚Äú unit where he received exemplary care as he was very distressed and disorientated. He was then transferred to the MRU where once again the doctors and staff provided him with exemplary care and reassured him. He is being discharged today from Gentian Ward where the staff have again looked after him, and have been kind to update me on his progress.
The NHS and King George‚Äôs Hospital are often given a bad press, but I would like to thank everyone involved in my husbands care for being professional, caring and kind to him during his stay.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Abysmal technology, incompetent staff  - must be‚Ä¶
body:
The telephone system is a joke - hours waiting (literally) then cut off. Calling back and going round in circles. People will probably die waiting/have died waiting and what is the point in Government urging people not to overload A&E but to see a GP if you can never get through to speak to one, let alone see one.

The staff are very badly trained and tell you one thing whilst another member of staff states completely the opposite. The shiny new centre is completely understaffed and under resourced.

Given every review here is terrible it begs the question as so what more has to happen before the NHS, local MP, Clinical Commissioning Group etc intervenes to prevent easily preventable deaths and injury.

title: Urgent Care Centre gave incorrect advice!
body:
I had called 111 as I'd had a very swollen and painful big toe which was also hot and the redness and pain spreading to the lower foot. They made an appointment for me to see the nurse at the Wycombe Urgent care center that morning. The nurse examined it and suspected it is a case of gout. I was told no treatment could be given for gout without a blood test confirming it's present. She said I'd need to organise a blood test with my GP. I asked if it could by done by urgent care and was told it definitely had to be done via my GP. I did an online request for a blood test with the Marlow Medical Group and a while later got a callback saying that the urgent care center should have organised the blood test and that the Marlow Medical Group can't do a blood test for me until OCTOBER as the NHS is running low on blood test vials!!!!! They also said a blood test for gout is normally 14-21 days after the gout atrack. When I asked why the person said "that's what I've been told", I asked if she was medically trained and she said she wasn't, it's a pity the doctor didn't bother to speak to me as they could've explained the reason why the blood test is taken a few weeks later when gout is suspected ( thanks to Google I now know).
My toe and foot are still red, swollen and painful and I still don't know if it's gout or an infection within the joint. In a functioning NHS guess if have had a fluid sample from the joint to rule out an infection but it looks like that's not happening. I feel very let down by the NHS with both departments blaming each other.

title: Poor consultation
body: I didn't feel like I had the full attention of the doctor. He didn't listen to me or look at the pictures I was trying to show him. He had made his mind up on his diagnosis within a minute and wasn't interested in discussing further.

title: cant keep appointments so why should we circle
body:
Very disappointed today , i booked a vaccine for a suitable time, only for this to basically be completely disregarded on arrival and i was made to wait in a queue. This meant, by me arriving actually early for my appointment (expecting appointments to be respected) by 15-20 minutes, I ended up waiting over an hour until leaving and being seen to over half an hour later than my time. 

I did tell the person signing in my appt time but in the queue no body was available to tell and we actually had to fill out our own details on a form - more laziness from staff in my opinion. There was a person apologising to people for their long wait but no explanation as to why this was happening was offered. 

I appreciate everyone needs a break in their working day , however replacing the people would beneficial rather than operating on 3 or 4 booths with 6-8 available and only 2 people administering the actual vaccines. 

Ventilation was appalling throughout the mayo building with every window and door possible to be closed, duly closed maximising the risk to anyone in the hospital. Staff walking through the corridors with their earphones blasting music / phone calls (which i could clearly hear) to then place their clearly person phones in pockets does nothing to inspire confidence or confidentiality or security either. 

The people actually working were pleasant and professional enough but the designation of staff was clearly wrong - with 3 or 4 signing people in to appointments for then a large queue of people waiting for appointments.

In future, I feel it should be made public that appointments aren't kept by this hospital so in future people can have the option of finding a competent place to go for medical issues. I did have my first vaccine in another place and it was amazing the difference in standards

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great care
body: My sons pregnant girlfriend contacted Covid and the baby was delivered safely and through your excellent care, Shauni has survived and she is now safely at home with her baby and Family. Thank you so very, very much for all your hard work through this unprecedented times KMH.

title: The worst medical center I have ever been
body:
The worst medical center I have ever been!
Reaching reception and making appointment is almost impossible. If you are lucky and got answered, they have technical issues - for over a year now - and can't hear you, and finish your call...if they will hear you - quite often they are rude...
For non emergency appointment you need to wait 6 weeks minimum. 
Over pandemic, despite being pregnant I couldn't see GP, I only spoke with administrator, got antibiotics and steroids over a phone. Not responsible at all!!!
Oh and they lost my prescription few times too...and now they forgot call me and make an appointment while I was on waiting list and I lost it and need to wait again 4-6 weeks...
Stay away from it!

title: Efficient and good service
body: Staff have lovely manner when you call. I was seen and dealt with quickly and with great care, humour and efficiency

title: Fantasic ER Cardiology experience
body:
I went to the ER yesterday with chest pains.  My care throughout the experience was excellent and well above expectations!

I was lucky enough that stress and blood tests showed my pains were not heart related. However, the care and attention I received made me confident they would have continued into excellent care had my issue been more severe.

As is, I am blown away by how excellent the care was at Straub. I will not hesitate to recommend them to others!

author: laurenjade3
title: Implant removal and fitting
body: I went to the clinic to get my implant removed and a new one fitted. The doctor and nurses were very kind and polite and made me feel comfortable. üôÇ

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: yankeess96
title: My husband is in Craigavon hospital
body: My husband is currently in hospital and due to covid there is no visiting but he has MS and has problems with his speech his hands and basically handling a mobile phone . We had no way of contacting him or of seeing him but thankfully on one occasion the hospital staff had given him the phone and we got to speak to him but I really needed to c him . That's when I heard of virtual visiting service , it was brilliant.  I could arrange a time to speak to him and see him, he was as happy as me at the first call ,they supplied him with an iPad which they set up for him so he didn't have to answer it or handle it which kept him from getting fustrated  and we got to talk for ages . I can recommend it to everyone you don't need a top of the range mobile it's really simple and easy to sort and it has made all the difference to me and my husband .Thank you

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lucky57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Ambulance and ambulatory
body:
I came into hospital by ambulance in the early hours of Monday morning. The ambulance took over 6 hours to come but once it arrived the staff were all nice. I was brought into A+E where I stayed from 4am until 9am the next day. I was in a bed and all the staff were nice.  
I sometimes find it hard to understand what the doctor is saying but he was very nice.  
I was moved from A+E into the ambulatory unit which has been good because the staff would do anything for you and the ward is very clean. The main issue is that since I arrived in hospital I have never been given a pillow. One of the nurses made one from a towel for me but it isn't as comfortable as a real pillow would be.  
Apart from this, I have received excellent care in Craigavon Hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency

author: Hamiltonlass
title: ED Hairmyres University Hospital
body: I was extremely impressed with the standard of care I received this morning. The wait time was great at only 2hrs, every staff member was polite and cheery and the place was spotless. There was a wonderful nurse called Louise who epitomizes what a great nurse is. I myself am a nurse of Scottish descent but currently work in America. The USA with all of its private health care needs to take some lessons from our amazing NHS. I feel people in the UK have no idea how lucky they are to have this amazing service. If I had gone to ED in America even with private health care it would have cost me $150 to be seen. Then a percentage of the bill would still need to be paid. Thank you NHS for all that you do. Thank you Hairmyres Hospital for taking great care of me. Thank you Louise you were wonderful!

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

title: Wonderful GP
body: This Dr has been our family GP for over 30 years. Last week he sent my husband to A&E following a surgery appointment, and most probably saved his life. Throughout the pandemic, he has always been accessible - he has always found a way to see patients most in need after a telephone consultation (even when the pandemic was at its worse). I can‚Äôt praise him (and his team) enough for how hard they have worked to provide health and medical care - but most importantly for recognising how much in danger my husband was in and saw him without hesitation and made the life saving decision to get him specialist help. We are so fortunate to have such a wonderful GP - and a fantastic Health Service.

title: Excellent practice
body: I attended the surgery 01/09/2021 for a routine examination the receptionists were friendly and helpful. The doctor greeted me with respect and he was very courteous asking me questions about my symptoms. He made me feel calm and comfortable with his lovely manner. I write this review as over the last two days I‚Äôve had two telephone consultations and a visit to the surgery and found the whole experience overall outstanding at the practice. Thank you to the two doctors who went out of their way to do the appropriate tests that I needed and put my mind at rest. I have been with this practice 11 years now and I‚Äôve never had any issues at all the staff they done an amazing job of looking after me. I appreciate everything you have done for me and you deserve some credit for the excellent service you provided to me.

title: Good practice, excellent staff
body:
I had to call a couple of times to book appointments and the lady at the reception is always extremely helpful, cheerful and caring even though sometimes they have a huge load of calls to answer. This makes the whole experience much better.
The doctors and nurses are equally caring and helpful. I would definitely recommend this practice.

title: Best Sexual Health service I‚Äôve used
body:
Received brilliant advice and experience from the SHL service at the Waldron clinic. The nurse who I had the appointment with was friendly and insightful, and we had a great discussion on various stigmas that still need to be overcome in sexual education.

Will definitely use this practice again!

readBy.name: Lewisham and Greenwich NHS Trust

title: Staff care
body: After a fall  my partner was admitted first into ward 28, he passed away after 9 days of wonderful care, we as a family would like to extend our thanks for the compassion and care shown to not only my partner but the whole family at an extremely difficult time despite challenging patient numbers and staffing levels, the staff's level of dedication and care is outstanding and applauded, we are eternally thankful for making a very difficult time bearable.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very friendly practice.
body: Were seen promptly on arrival. Extremely friendly and knowledgeable explanation of my symptoms, and clear advice on how to treat them. Left the practice feeling quite happy with the consultation.

title: very good
body: all the staff specially the doctors are very accommodating,approachable,shout out to the GP who done my operation procedure on my lip greatly appreciated,it‚Äôs a life changing for me.Thanks to all the day and night staff very friendly.

title: Excellent and high standard of patient care
body:
I have always been impressed by the efficient response to my online requests often within the hour. 

Recently I had the need to contact the practice due to a problem with my knee, I contacted the practice late in the day and within 10-15 minutes of doing so, received a call from one of the lovely GP's, who booked me in to see him at the practice within the hour. My knee was examined and bloods taken, with the GP following up with me the very next day, keeping me informed.  

An exceptional level of patient care, delivered with a super efficient and very friendly service. I could not ask for more. 

Well done and Thank you so very much.

title: Happy with the service I have recently received
body: I just wanted to say 'thanks' to the team at Waterloo health. My recent foot problems were dealt with very thoroughly, and surprisingly quickly considering the current situation. Thanks again for your work.

title: A and E great team
body: Yesterday I had to go in A and E what a fantastic team,my treatment was brilliant,from going to comeing home,I felt cared for and respected,and a lovely team spirit amongst the staff,helping one another,was lovely to watch,three young men who where students,where so Caring,thoughtful and young men to be proud of,one put a candler in my hand with such professionalism it was amazing how skilful he was,not a mark on my hand,not a bruise in sight well done young man,and thank you every oneüòä

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent treatment
body: I came in for a tooth extraction. An experience I was dreading turned out to be so much better than I was expecting: no waiting, efficiency and kindness. I couldn't have had better, or more sensitive, treatment.

title: Great service
body:
I called regarding my child, under 5, who was experiencing rectal bleeding.
The receptionist listened to my concerns, asked good questions and manages to find me an appointment straight away.
The doctor we saw was also thorough, great rapport with my child and allayed any fears.

title: Kindness and Care
body: My father was resident at Mayfield for a short time before he passed away.  The management and staff were always helpful, kind and caring and from my experience showed much respect for the residents and their families.  They could not have done more for us   to help my father settle in his new surroundings. Nothing was too much trouble.  I would definitely recommend Mayfield to anyone looking for a home for their loved one.

title: Worst service ever
body:
This is the worst GP surgery I have ever had the misfortune to deal with. The reception staff have no communications skills and are extremely rude, unhelpful, dismissive and bullying. It wasnt just the service I received I witnessed several interactions between the staff and patients, all were treated as if they were wasting their time. There must be understanding that patients visit doctors at times when they need help, they should not be dismissed and shouted at. I know doctors receptionists have a general reputation but these are beyond the pale. Clearly some management issues here if that is considered to be acceptable behaviour. 
If you want to know what I mean just spend some time sitting in the waiting room and listen to how patients are spoken to at reception. Avoid this surgery at all costs.

title: Disgusting
body: I hate this doctors.  I use our of hours now as there is never an appointment. I mean NEVER. they are useless. And they have one dr who is rubbish.   The nurse never calls back when told she will.   I wished I could change

title: Worst in Kent
body:
This has been my doctors for nearly 10 years. The Doctors are rude, lazy 
 and don‚Äôt care about the patients, the receptionists are even worse! There is no Management and the Doctors do whatever they want and get away with it.  It was voted worst Doctors in Kent a little while ago. Avoid if you can.

title: Trying to get to see a doctor
body: on behalf or mother who for the last two week has suffered with Ear/head ache rang and spoke to a doctor who told her to keep taking paracetamol for two more days ... she already taken them for two weeks why would two days make a difference, but we are back at the beginning ringing and try to get a appointment and we are 5 days further down the line ...  and on line does not work for my mother who does not own or understand computers

readBy.name: Healthwatch Bradford

title: Appalling Service
body: Continuing with poor service culture for patients. No respect for anyone or their time. Booked an appointment, no one called all day. Chased it as I was suffering badly SMs was assured that a doctor will call. No one called and the next day I have been told they have no appointments.

title: Appalling Service
body: Requested and got an appointment for yesterday. No one contacted, on chasing, I was assured a doctor will call. No one did! Been told today that there is no appointment.

title: Unresponsive & Unreliable
body: Booked an online appointment without any email confirmation. Called several times to double check the time of appointment, no one ever answers. Will not visit again.

title: Terrible
body: Where to start.. as soon as you walk in the reception ladies will look at you with disgust which is just beginning when you start speaking to them nicely they speak with so much arrogance that you don't feel like stand there another minute. I have mental health issues even if I'm desperate for my Dr I avoid going there as the staff's behaviour upsets me.

title: Staff so professional and kind
body:
I attended yesterday for a hernia repair operation as a day care patient. The professionalism and kindness shown by the nurses and staff was wonderful. I was in at 8.00 am and home again by 12.00
noon. Please thank all the staff for attention I was given.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: EXCELLENT CARE
body: I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the whole of the ICU Department at Russells Hall Hospital.  Each and every doctor, all the nurses and the surgeon who operated on our dear Father and saved his life I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for all the constant care you all have given a truly remarkable man a second chance of life.  You are all amazing thank you for all you have done.  God bless you all.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Badly managed
body:
Always struggle to get to speak to someone, let alone a GP, very different from my mother's surgery.
Latest attempt to get through ended in being cut off as "they're busy"! What about a queueing system??

title: Excellent service.
body: My husband and I have just joined the practice and we have had exemplary service so far. The receptionists have been extremely polite and helpful, and the doctors have been excellent on the telephone, as has the physiotherapist that I saw recently. We also spoke to the pharmacist who was equally very thorough and helpful. Each person we have spoken to has listened carefully, responded caringly and been very kind indeed. Thank you all. It is such a difficult time for everyone in these Covid times and we are very impressed with the service thus far.

title: Caring deputy manager
body: This is a busy practice but the deputy manager has always been so friendly and helpful and find a little bit of time to resolve my enquiry no matter how stressed her job role is, I have never experienced anything other than excellent service and she always has a lovely smile to everyone. Deputy manager always does my repeat prescriptions for me and my husband on time no concern at all if there any confusion she will call the chemist herself to sort it out straight away . THANK YOU.

title: Very poor patient service
body:
No one from the department phoned on the date/time (+/- 1 hour) of appointment though a salutory cll was made some 6 hrs after the allotted time.
Attempts to contact someone on the day to find out what was happening were left unanswered (phone / email)
Eventually contacted someone a couple of days later (after many attempts) who gave a new appointment within a couple of weeks.  Subsequently letter arrived confirming appointment was months away.
A prior telephone appointment held an hour early when relative of hard of hearing patient wasn't present - no notes sent from that meeting so family has no idea what went on.
Notes were sent eventually to GP, but no understnding of what was to be happening.
All in all a thoroughly awful service.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Amazing service
body:
I had a positive mammogram in June, was recalled to the Breast Clinic and seen within 3 weeks, had an ultrasound to confirm the mass which was biopsied. A week later I was seen with the results - an intraductal carcinoma - I saw the Breast Care nurse, the surgeon, had a further ultrasound to place a marker beside the tumour, a mammogram to confirm position and given a date for surgery 4 weeks later. I had surgery in the Arthur South Day Procedure unit which was comfortable and a reassuring atmosphere, I went home 
 in the afternoon and have just been seen for a follow up appointment. Throughout my treatment has been professional, kindly, considerate and a really pleasant experience. I cannot praise the breast care team highly enough and am very grateful to the NHS and in particular the N&NUH.  Thank you.

title: Needs an overhaul
body:
lthough the medical staff are caring and professional, the surgery management is terrible. You are expected to discuss private info with reception staff in front of other patients, phone waits are close to 1 hr, appointments for working people are extremely limited, and prescriptions are often messed up. Sadly, the practice has been getting steadily worse for 2-3 years, so this has nothing to do with the pandemic.
I am at the point of no longer taking medication because dealing with this surgery is so stressful and frustrating.
I sincerely hope the administration improves at this practice so that it adequately supports both patients and the hard working medical staff.

title: Caring and kind
body: I recently gave birth at the maternity unit at Good Hope hospital. I have to say my experience was amazing! Everyone from the ward manager, the surgery team, the cleaning team through to the nursery nurse was kind, caring and provided a high level of expertise across floor 5 and the labour unit. I was induced but ended up having a c section and there was no doubt that I was in safe hands. I came out feeling in ore of the staff and their ethos.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good service
body: Helpful and friendly reception staff, the doctors are approachable and knowledgeable and I feel the waiting times are very reasonable considering the current strains on the practice.

title: Great surgery
body: I have had a recent medical heart condition which I am under the doctor to monitor my medication and discuss any concerns I have. The doctor has been fantastic in supporting me through this stressful time and always has time to talk when I need to.

title: Outstanding service
body:
Excellent service. I changed my Surgery from Owen Road to Dalton Square Practice around 6-7 years ago I have found the GPS and other staff to be very helpful and supportive throughout my time here. Recently I had issues with lack of correspondence from the Mental health team and the practice went above and beyond to help me get updates and answers which has been the upmost beneficial to me. I found the service to be very professional polite helpful & caring supportive and go above and beyond for their patients.

Thank you üôè

title: Vv poor general practice brings tears to my eyes
body: There are so many problems with this gp surgery that I don‚Äôt know where to begin. Today was the last straw. Contacted them through an econsult for a growth and told to wait. I‚Äôd spent an hour on the phone waiting as I was caller no 10. Everything is too much trouble for the staff at this practice. I explained that the patient should be seen within 14 days for something like this. I was told that the practice manager and senior dr were both on holiday and ‚Äòeveryone deserves a holiday‚Äô when I said that they have a duty of care. So sick of not being able to get through and then not being able to get an appointment. Somebody needs to take a close look at this NHS funded gp practice and soon!!!

title: Accident and Emergency helpful and efficient.
body: First attendance here with an injury and was impressed with the kindness and efficiency of all the staff on a clearly busy night.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Highly recommended practice
body: I feel so fortunate that Killick St Health Centre was recommended to me. I was allocated a wonderful GP there who is friendly, approachable, thorough and very knowledgeable, with that rare ability to explain things clearly without talking down or being patronising. This GP clearly has considerable experience of both medicine and the workings of the NHS and has addressed every aspect of my health ‚Äì and conscientiously followed up on each one. I have contacted the Centre online, by phone and in person and always received a prompt response. Very impressive! The Centre is clean and organised and the administrative staff polite and efficient both in person and on the phone. Highly recommended.

title: Massively disrespectful
body: The only way to get an appointment is to call them - they wont accept you calling in person to book - they run a phone queue, BUT, when you reach the front of the queue you discover the queue is only reducing because people are dropping off, as they dont actually answer the phone. If you complain, they call you rude.  Sure I understand they may be busy, but this behavior is massively disrespectful and deceitful.

title: Amazing staff
body: Today I attended the Dermatology department for an emergency appointment. Due to child care issues I had to bring my 4 year old who is autistic. Whilst there the nursing staff and reception staff were beyond amazing towards my son. Not only did they offer him a drink but they gave him biscuits and cakes they put cbeebies on the TV for him and also gave him pens and paper. I have never attended a hospital that has been so kind and caring to myself my son and my partner. They took the time to sit with my son and talk to him and draw with him. Thank you so much for your help. Thank you for being so understanding.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Sheffield Hallam University, Nursing BSc (21-9)

title: Great practice
body: I was seen on time for my appointment and there was a female chaperone in them room during the gynaecologist internal examination. Dignity and respect was shown throughout the appointment. I was shown compassion by the gynaecologist and the nurse/HCA. Everything was explained to me and treatment was offered at a later date. I was anxious during the appointment as I‚Äôve had bad experiences in the past but I would highly recommend this healthcare practice for a gynaecologist appointment, he took the time to listen to me and to understand how I have been suffering.

title: Fantastic care
body:
I had a CT scan yesterday and i must say that the care that i received was first class. 
After booking in, i sat in the waiting room and in no time at all a lady came and got me to change into a gown.
I was then taken into the room and two lovely radiographers got me ready for the scan. One confirmed my details and the other lady got the 'bed' ready for me. I lay down and one lady went over with me what was going to happen during the scan while the other radiographer inserted a cannula into my arm as i was having a contrast injection. 
They went into the room to start doing the scan and then came out and started the contrast injection running. 
In no time at all the scan had been completed. The lovely radiographer helped me to sit up and then i sat in the waiting room for 15 minutes before the cannula was removed.
The lady who removed it was very kind, pleasant and very gentle too.
I have been having scans on and off for 27 years and i must say a big well done to all the staff involved especially during these difficult, busy and demanding times.

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent GP
body: My GP is always attentive, courteous and prompt and I also believe she does the best she can in the circumstances. She is very good at diagnosis, wants to get it right, further treatment actions and follow up. Well done and all the best to you!

title: Not a pleasant Experience
body: If the patient was not suffering from anxiety before they soon would be after the simple request of a sick note, the anxiety of losing one's job and depression of having to make phone call after phone call to ask for a sick note

title: Great practice
body:
I experienced excellent service from Health Harmonie. The staff were all very personable and professional. 
I felt at ease throughout

title: Best Medical Care
body: From phone calls, to emails, to a rare house visit, this practice gets a 10 across the board.  You feel heard and cared for by all levels of personnel.  We left the practice only because we moved out of area.  We miss them terribly.

title: Very helpful, very caring
body: Laser treatment for diabetic retinopathy: Very helpful and reassuring to a nervous patient. Explained everything so I could understand what the treatment was

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant Practice
body: Our family has used this practice for nearly 15 years. It has always been excellent! Wonderful care from the Receptionists, Doctors and Nurses. Well done everyone for coping with the recent Pandemic- you have been amazing!

title: Great practice
body: Despite all the negative reviews on social media I experienced something quite different. I rang the Surgury and the phone was answered immediately. I spoke to a very pleasant lady who, after explaining my problems to her, said that someone from the triage team would call me by 6 today. Some 30 minutes later a doctor called me, listened very intently to my problems and have arranged for several tests to be done today and a prescription issued which I can collect later. In all, a very efficient service and I can only thank everyone at the Surgury for being polite, understanding and very attentive. Thank you all. A very satisfied patient.

title: excellent care
body: I recently attended a nurse clinic, I found my nurse to be exceptionally kind, caring and professional. 10/10

title: Excellent practice
body:
Gave me time, and detailed information,showing me MRI scan.
Very supportive from whole team.Efficient treatment followed.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Note of appreciation
body:
I am very privileged to be with this GP practice. They conducted the COVID vaccination program very efficiently.
I am extremely grateful for their health advice and support.

title: what a wonderful place ,full of love
body: i was on holmwood ward after taking an overdose ,the care i was given was practical,professional and above all given with genuine concern for my wellbeing which although made me cry ,it was because of the kindness shown to me that has made me realise that there are good people out there who work damned hard and still make our world a brighter place ,thanks to all ,you know who you are and you have my undying respect in a very hard  job ,well done esh

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Thanku best hospital
body: Highly recommended hospital withinshaw hospital the best I come in 2019 first lung surgery stapled fixd I come 12 th August had op 19th now recovering second lung surgery on other side thanku withinshaw for looking after me all at F3 Lung ward I try act like am super am not just same as anyone else no different I just try to stay strong thanku withinshaw hospital

readBy.name: Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not Acceptable
body: De Parys is riding on it's previous good reputation. All the old doctors have left and since the practice has joined up with many others in Bedford, there is no longer any service - the reception staff simply cannot cope - it is not fit for purpose. It is almost impossible to get through on the phone as other reviews have said. A very long message before you even get to the options and their hope is to cut you off. I have had a health problem for a few months now - but cannot get through. Will be changing surgeries.

title: very good practice
body: a very good practice have always found helpful staff but am disappointed that i could not have wax removed from ears i a an 81 year old pensioner and having to pay ¬£70 for this treatment which surgeries have always done where is the duty of care here?

title: Don't bother
body:
Don't even bother trying with this practice! On 1 September, I called at 8am (like requested) to book an appointment, only to spend 45 minutes on hold and it disconnects when I get to the front of the queue. Tried to call again and spent another 1 hour 25 minutes on hold for it to also disconnect when I get to the front of the queue!!

Do yourself a favour and change to a more reliable practice!

title: Communication has become ridiculous
body: Its become so frustrating to contact the surgery. I don't want to faff around with an econsult I want to talk to someone, things are too complicated sometimes. I tried to ring this morning and was 29 in the queue!! I got through and have to wait three weeks for an appointment on the phone... Not even an appointment a 2hr slot. I understand that covid is affecting the workload but waiting around for 2hrs is not an appointment. It means I can't do anything because I don't want to be discussing my personal matters in front of others. There has to come a point where we go back to proper face to face appointments as standard, especially for certain conditions that need a discussion and some empathy. It feels like a wall has been put up that won't be taken down. It's all the more frustrating because the Dr's are excellent and it's always been such a good practice.

title: Thank you for Listening
body:
Never have a problem talking to the Telephone ladies
They do the best they can
Have ALWAYS got a phone appointment even though you have to wait too long
If needed have always been given a Doc appointment or a Triage Nurse to help
Doc at my appt last week gave me time and space  she was wonderful though did say had other patients waiting But I needed her help which she gave
I just want to say thank you to all the Staff at the Practice
They are all super stars as far as Im concerned
And also have to mention the Pharmacy who are amazing
Thank you muchly

title: Practice nurse
body: Have been trying for over 2 weeks to get an appt with the nurse for an important vaccine.each time keep getting told that a message has been left with nurse, and when I phone again states need to leave another message or nurse on holiday etc  . So still unable to make a direct appointment over 2 weeks later

title: Impossible to contact
body: Tried  to book on line as per my doctor  would not give  a date rang number told no dates available  rang today kept getting  cut off

readBy.name: Bolton NHS Foundation Trust

title: The pits of the NHS.
body: I visited the A+E department yesterday (31/08/2021). The staff were extremely rude and discourteous. The NHS charter says patients should be treat with respect and dignity I doubt if they even know the meaning of those words.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Gets worse this surgery
body: Calls for an appointment persistent issue, the dr told me to call back if if the issue persisted, so I try to book another appointment have the receptionist the courtesy of explaining why I needed to speak with someone again. To be told we‚Äôve no triage appointments available call back tomorrow, what can‚Äôt I book for tomorrow because you have to call at 8am! Who on earth do I need to do that just book me something and stop being awkward! I know dr Singhu very well when I eventually get to see or speak with him I shall tell him he needs to resolve this issue with these receptionists they just want to be in command all the time and it‚Äôs there way or not at all! I can bet my life I will call in the morning to be told we have no appointments!!! GPS get bad press throughout Covid of bot being present it‚Äôs about time they started to ensure there receptionists made sure they are visible. And for the avoidance of any doubt this isn‚Äôt the first issue of this very nature I‚Äôve had at this surgery..some receptionists will go out of there way to help others just want to get you off the phone!

title: Terrible service and care
body: In the 7 months I have been a patient at this practice my health concerns have been dismissed. The Drs refuse to do face to face appointments and only send text messages to communicate which is horrific for someone who is worried about their health. I will be making a complaint to the GMC as I am really dissapointed and let down by your surgery.

title: Xray results
body: My experience has not been good at all. I had a chest X-ray on the 23/08/2021 at Braintree community hospital where I was told to ring my doctors a week later for the results. Well ive been trying all day today and cannot get through on any of your lines. Does anyone work there.....

title: Not worth the hassle
body: Tried to book an appointment. They only have phone appointments, which is fine, but they don't give you any specific times, just... 'We will call you in the morning'. Just missed the call and attempted to ring back immediately. After being put on hold for 40 min I was told they would get the doctor to call me back. Waited all day for nothing. It then took me 3 days of trying to get through on the phone, then having to wait another 45 min to get hold of a receptionist who told me all I could do now was go to ask my GP, which I then discovered, only operates for 2 hours per day. All of this just to speak to a doctor, which I still haven't been able to do. Really not worth it. Probably best to look into other practices in the area, they're obviously too busy to deal with you.

title: Terrible communication
body: The way some of the staff interact with patients definitely needs to be looked at. There is no permanent doctor in place so it's extremely difficult to get control of any ailments as its mostly always a different doctor. I feel completely let down by the surgery. Some of the ladies in reception are lovely though.

title: Reception Staff left a lot to be desired....
body:
I have always spoken very highly of Redcar Primary Care but I cannot be so positive on this occasion.  I had to visit the Emergency Minor Injury department, after a fall recently.  I am an older lady and my fall resulted in a cut, badly bleeding forehead, and possible broken finger.  

The receptionist was extremely curt with myself and with the person who accompanied me.  I would go so far as to say that she was most unpleasant, and I got the feeling that she didnt want to be there. She told me I'd have a long wait and to take a seat. That's fine, but I was bleeding profusely from my head, and feel it would have cost nothing to have at least given me a piece of gauze to wipe it.  As it was, I was left to sit with blood running down my face and dripping all over my coat.  After a long wait I was called through to the treatment room and the service there was completely different.  The gentleman who saw me was courteous, caring and very professional.

I know the NHS are under extreme pressure, and I have always spoken very highly of them, even defending them to some people.  However, I cannot defend this receptionist's rudeness, to anyone.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful
body: My prescriptions are never ready on time even when I keep within the time frame of ordering prescriptions. The medication I have to take is important for my mental health and well being. I can accept on a occasions that the practice is busy, I understand this as I work within the health sector myself. But this is an ongoing occurrence and is happening regularly. Regarding Prescriptions its awful.

title: Cannot get in touch
body:
I had a biopsy procedure with the Newham gynaecology department - this was over two weeks ago & I cannot get through to anyone at all for my test results. I have called literally upwards of 20 times a day only for the phone to ring and ring. To leave a 29 year old patient thinking they may have cancer, for weeks with no correspondence, is unacceptable. I know the admin staff ignore the phones, as I witnessed this in person when I went in for my appointment. I have searched for email addresses, contacted the main switch board, and asked my GP- to no avail. 
If anyone monitors this, please could I have a working phone number to chase my biopsy results??

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Awful
body:
Have been phoning weekly since my daughter‚Äôs assessment beginning of July.
No follow up, don‚Äôt return your calls as promised & give you the run around.
Zero level of care on their behalf totally let down & disgusted in the none existent care my daughter has received!

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Open, helpful and cooperative staff
body: I needed a GP confirmation about having recovered from Covid-19 and not having symptoms to be exempt from quarantine at my travel destination. I was not advised to take a PCR test as it would have likely be positive due to antibodies still being present in my system, and I understood that without a PCR the practice is unable to give a certification. Staff kindly offered to print out of a transcription of the online consultation where this has been discussed, and the authorities accepted the stamped transcription as sufficient evidence later on. Also, staff was very reassuring when explaining why to move onto it's sister practice, Stratford Health Centre, due to our change of address, and even contacted the other practice and emailed us a link to the registration form to make the transfer as swift as possible.

title: Poor practise
body: Can never get an appointment, doctors are rude and quick to send you elsewhere. I work full time I‚Äôve got a bad chest infection shortness of breath fever aching all over, yet they tell me my own doctors to contact a walk in centre. Which all walk in centres now direct you to the hospital. Why do I pay national insurance when I can‚Äôt get any medical help.

title: Staff member are extremely rude
body: Very bad experience for me to register in that surgery, twice I have been there always been ignored, I feel really humiliate on that reception.

title: Impractical
body: I work 5 days a week and request a call back during the times I am on my breaks. I get told they are unable to ring back at certain times to speak with me about arranging an appointment. It is extremely unprofessional and impractical for them to call me any other time when I can only take a call during the times I have provided. I get told I am on a list and they will call me when they reach my name on the list. It is common sense to miss my name out on the list when you get to it if it‚Äôs during the time I cannot speak and obvious to swap me for someone else further down the list which would be more suitable. Every time I try and ring this happens and it‚Äôs unfair to say we can only ring you at a certain time when I am working everyday during the week for North Tyneside Council. It comes across that my issue is not important and it doesn‚Äôt matter if they can‚Äôt speak to me. Today I was meant to get a call back but I did not, which led me to ring the practice to be told a nurse has worth a note to say she tried to call me at 8:50 when she was made aware I could not answer the phone until 9:15 - 9:45. I didn‚Äôt even receive a call at 8:50, there was no missed call not a voicemail left. Very disappointing and unprofessional.

readBy.name: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service
body:
How is a service this bad allowed to operate where health is concerned?

Had an urgent but non emergency medical issue. Online appointments only offered slots 2.5 weeks in the future....for a telephone call.

Trying to call the surgery and speak to someone is impossible. If you try the appointments option you get told likes are busy. If you try the general enquiries option you get told you are second in queue and then the line gets dropped after about 8 mins....I have a feeling no one is monitoring the lines at all. 

A GP service is one of the rare services where a face to face appointment is more necessary than in most other industries. 3 weeks for a phone call is just not good enough. There should be regulations on this sort of wait

title: Canclled my appointment 24 hours to go.
body: I received a phone call saying my appointment would be moved by a week as they did not have my referral (whatever this means). So i phoned my GP they said they had sent it 8 days before the phone call. I then phone BMI and after waiting quite a bit, I get through to someone who cant full help me so tried to put me through to someone else who could not be reached. I arranged to be called back. I got the phone call about 20 mins later to be told that they actually had everything they needed and don't know how it happened but my appointment has already been moved. This strikes me as incompetence and am not very happy as I feel my appointment has been moved unnecessarily due to someone not doing their job properly. I say this because no explanation as to why this has happened was offered, all she said was "I don't know how this happened". Completely Unacceptable!!!

readBy.name: BMI Healthcare Ltd

title: Can't get through to the practice on the telephone
body:
I know the NHS is under pressure, so why has Kilmeny Group Practice written to my husband asking him to get in touch for his Diabetes review when it is impossible to get through to them by telephone.  He has called them five times today in response to their request, each time waiting a significant length of time - the last time was for 54 minutes.  He has now given up. 

Similarly, I was contacted by text last week with an appointment for my annual hypertension review.  The text said that they have now introduced a text service so that if I cannot make the appointment I could text.  I did this as the appointment clashes with a work meeting.  The surgery clearly haven't read it, as I received a telephone message stating I had an appointment on the date and time I said I couldn't attend.  Kilmeny and the Modality Partnership were really good in the response to Covid, but unfortunately their day-to-day health management processes are woeful.

title: Pathetic service
body: Despite being constantly told by recorded voice while trying to get through, that I can make appts. via Doctorlink, this is untrue as this surgery no longer accepts online bookings! Today, I have rung up to make an appt., I started off at 7th in the queue, 45mins later, I had made it to no.1, after 9mins I briefly heard someone in the background then got cut off, this is the 3rd time this has happened this year. Almost an hour of my life wasted by this pathetic excuse of a surgery. I am now looking to join another one!

title: Awful security & staff at main entrance
body: Awful experience. Rude staff. I came with a relative in a wheelchair who needs assistance I was told I was unable to enter. I explained there needs and that they needed help but was still refused entry. I then waited outside with my mask on and got told I could not wait there even though I was not near anybody nor was there any signs saying I couldn‚Äôt. Staff all gained up and was rude shouting at me. Won‚Äôt return and wouldn‚Äôt come here even if I was dying.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent procedure for my cataract operation
body: The actual surgery was first class but the aftercare needed a lot to be desired. I got an infection in the eye that was operated on and the NHS BMI could offer no support because there wasn‚Äôt any permanent eye department in situ. Eventually I went to St.Thomas‚Äôs to visit the emergency eye department where I was advised that I had an infection and prescribed steroid drops to use for a month. If I was offered an hospital with a permanent eye department I could have gone there. It was very stressful time because sight is so very precious and having no support in place after eye surgery.

title: Terrible Service
body:
Called Warden lodge today 01/09/2021. I was having a problem with my prescription which I needed to resolve as soon as possible.
Having went through the usual press 1, 2 ect. I was first in the queue. The pre-recorded message informing me that all receptionists are busy and will be with you as soon as possible.
When I first called I was first in the queue and when I finally gave up I was still first in the queue.
In all I was on the phone for 51 minutes 25 seconds. 
Sorry to say that once again I have to say that this surgery is terrible. I would give ZERO stars if I could.
Still haven't resolved my prescription issue. I will run out soon which will lead to serious issues for my health.

title: Unable to contact
body: No notification of delivery received, medication due in 5 days, have had to take a days annual leave today as I have been waiting for over 4 hours today. I would not use the service if I had a choice, we need to remember it is paid for! It is hard for everyone at the moment and staff are good when you can get through, in its present form the organisation does not seem fit for purpose and this is a management issue. I have no choice but to wait as the alternative is not having medication delivered. To say frustrated is an understatement.

title: Poor response for non-urgent matters.
body:
You can rarely easily get through to the Practice by phone. Right now you don't even get into the queue - the phone just rings forever then rings off.

I've recently had two sets of tests done - blood tests and CT head scan. Both had results returned to the Practice at the relevant time, but nobody bothered to convey those results to me. I couldn't ring them because of the above problem getting through on the phone. Luckily I live nearby so on both occasions went in to speak to the receptionist who conveyed the results to me in person (in a waiting room full of other people). Nothing particularly embarrassing, both tests all clear, but surely this is not the way it should be!? 

An absence of communication gives patients absolutely no comfort whatsoever. If there's no time or capacity to call just ping a text to confirm a negative test at the very least.

I'm currently wanting to book an appointment to discuss an elective procedure. I can't even book one! It's Wednesday now and I'm told to try calling back on Monday. Why can't the receptionist just schedule an appointment some time in the future?? Why should I need to suffer your phone system again?

I know you have to triage and give more urgent stuff priority, but I am no malingerer and have generally made very little use of the NHS... at least let me book an appointment for some time in the future?

Sorry this is so negative. When I get to see people, they're always efficient and helpful, but seeing them is a real trial!

title: Thoughtful Principals
body:
Nice condolence letter from the Practice Management on my mother's passing though she'd only been registered with them a few weeks.

Thank you
Ian Rattray
